reviewText: Thank you we loved the movie.  We are a lover of horse and dog movies so it is great to add it to our collection.
Since this film was made at the Meadows Race Track outside of Pittsburgh, I enjoy showing it to tour groups I am leading on bus trips.  Its a good movie for all different groups of people.
It is a great movie and every family should watch it. You will enjoy it and so will the rest of the family.

When I saw that Louis Gossett, Jr. and Charles Durning were in it, I figured I'd give a try.  Reminds me of the dogs that Michael Caine appeared in because he needed money and as he said..they paid me.

The ignorance about race horses and training is absurd and inexcusable...  he has a filly with a bad leg and the next thing he does is not just jog her, but give her a fast trip at racing speed...  why not just shoot her and get it over with.  The number of mistakes, well, I lost count after awhile.  The storyline is lame, it seems that not just the horse has that problem, and we still never learn what the heck motivation is behind the bad guy's grudge.  Even jerks need a reason to hate someone.

There was a good story to be told here, too bad the script writer never figured out how to tell it.  And for the record...  you don't RIDE  harness horses, you DRIVE them.  And you sure as heck don't let them canter around when in harness...  if they don't trot or pace they are disqualified in a race, so you certainly don't let them learn bad habits while in harness.

Amazing Racer is an amazing story!  It keeps you interested in what's going on til the very end!  I highly recommend this DVD!

I hate when a movie leaves you hanging as this one so blatantly did.  The storyline as a whole was okay, but I was left wondering why the trainer was training anymore and wondering what the whole story was with the guy that was arrested.  Very disappointing!
This is about great movie:  all teenage girls would love this movie. Please rent or buy this movie for any girl with a passion for horses. What a fabulous show.

This was the best movie, I watched it over and over, it had it all...I loved the story about healing after a loss, also the bond between Rainbow the horse and Shannon was powerful, I can relate to that bond, with my own animals, i LOVED the birth mother her character was warm and wonderful,,,all the characters where wonderful and great actors, there was nothing i didn't like about this movie, except the part where Rainbow was claimed in a claims race by a horrible horse trainer Mitchel and well the condition the horse came back was very sad, but healing thru love of Rainbow from shannon was heartwarming...so I LOVED THIS MOVIE, it also was recvd quickly......the only part that might upset younger people was where Rainbow wasn't treated nicely by the horrible Mitchell
This movie has it all, good and evil, victims and vandals. But in the end the law comes and gets the proud evil ones and the just win. Worth watching. Good life lessons.
This movie showed me about the good and bad choices we make and how we treat others. They can have good or bad consequences. The movie showed this in a entertaining way.

experience a struggling teen who finds a life through a dramatic horse friendship. the relationship has some life challenges for both and ultimately love conquers.

This is an outstanding, heart-warming movie for the whole family and those who love horse racing.  I am, however, wondering why there is NO recognition of JASON GEDRICK, who most definitely had a major role in this movie...and did a fine job, I might add.  He's not mentioned in the star line-up on the front of the DVD, nor in any description of this movie.  I've been a huge fan of Jason Gedrick's since I first saw him in "Dare To Love", so shame on the promoters of Amazing Racer for not recognizing this fine actor.
This is a good movie for the entire family. Lot of emotions in this film...anger, compassion, understanding, love to name a few.

We need more hope and more compassion in this world. This movie had a nice message and I really liked the acting. I have a Standardbred...so how could this movie be anything but 5 stars? Watch it....you won't be disappointed.

This movie about a girl who finds out her mother is alive, after her father's death. This movie is an example of how the circumstances can change anybodies life's from one day to the other.  It is movie about the value of truth, hard work, family and real friendship.

This movie has some of the classic elements of a "horse" movie, but at the same time some substance that makes it a movie of its own.  A young girl finds out after her father dies that she has a Mother.  A real and live one, not one who died in childbirth like her Dad told her.  Naturally, there is shock on both sides.  And while she and her Mother try to make things work at least for a summer trial period, they do still both have adjustments to make.  Enter into the picture her Mother's boyfriend's horse farm and a special horse that only the girl can get to race well.  Unfortunately, there is a rival horse farm with a spy in their midst.  And they pick up the filly in a claims race only to proceed to beat her and mistreat the poor horse.  However, through the eventual rehabilitation of the horse with a trainer named Max, all turns out well.  The movie leaves one feeling refreshed and happy.  Which is a pleasant and rare feeling nowadays.  So I recommend this movie highly.  It only has one mild swear word in it.  So it is suitable for family viewing.
This has to be one of the most unrealistic movies about harness racing I have ever seen.  It is a fairly tale.  Anyone involved in the sport would find it laughable.
